content.card1Body: Use social listening and market trends to discover white space and growth opportunities for your brand.
content.card2Body: Leverage customer data and growth drivers to turn market insights into actionable concepts.
content.card3Body: Identify competitive risks and improve your chances of successful commercialization.
content.sectionGlobalSubtitle: Insights reveal consumer desires for innovative and functional furniture solutions that enhance living spaces.
content.sectionCrossSubtitle: Insights across categories highlight common consumer needs and trends in furniture innovation.
content.sectionCrossInsight1Description: Consumers are increasingly seeking sustainable materials in their furniture choices.
content.sectionCrossInsight2Description: There is a noticeable trend towards integrating technology into furniture design for enhanced convenience.
content.sectionPersonasSubtitle: Understanding diverse consumer segments in furniture innovation.
content.sectionDocsSubtitle: These uploaded documents provide additional context to your overall analysis.
content.document1Insights:
Consumers prioritize sustainability in furniture choices.
Multi-functional furniture is increasingly popular.
Customization options are a key consumer desire.
content.document2Insights:
Smart furniture is gaining traction among tech-savvy consumers.
Urban dwellers seek space-saving solutions.
Sustainable materials are becoming a standard expectation.
content.personaWhatChanged: Trends like X and Y have made a significant impact on the market, making the wellness seeker X and Y more likely to X and Y, changing their Key Attribute and X and Y (Source).
content.personaDescription: A Brazilian wellness seeker who believes a fresh-smelling home is part of feeling mentally and physically well. They use aircare as a quick, low-effort way to 'reset' their space and mood.
content.personaDescriptionBullets:
Who they are: health-curious, home-proud, scent-as-wellbeing mindset
Anchored functional job: keep home air clean, inviting, and odor-free day to day
Context snapshot: Busy urban life, apartment living + humidity/food odors; primary aircare decision-maker; chooses scents that feel effective but not overpowering
content.personaCoreJtbd: They're trying to keep their home consistently fresh and welcoming, especially after cooking, humidity, or busy days, using simple aircare routines that work fast. They want to feel calm and restored in their space, and see a great-smelling home as a signal that they're caring for themselves and others with pride.
content.personaBehavioralJobs:
Maintains freshness through repeat buys and placement in key rooms, using scent as the 'finish' to cleaning and daily home care.
Triggers quick 'reset' moments after cooking, rain/humidity, pets, or guests, often pairing Glade with ventilation for fast impact.
Shifts between modesâ€”subtle daily maintenance vs. strong post-odor rescue vs. guest-ready fragranceâ€”depending on time, energy, and stakes.
content.personaTriggersRoutines:
Triggers: Kicks in before guests or right after cooking, cleaning, or rainy/humid daysâ€”especially when the home air starts to feel 'heavy' or stale.
Routines: Quick daily freshness touchpoints (morning or post-clean), plus stronger weekend or post-odor resets; intensity adjusts by mood and moment.
content.personaHiddenEmergingJobs: Hidden beneath "freshness," they're really using scent as a lightweight wellness tool to regulate mood and make home feel like a safe reset zone. Emerging jobs point to wanting air care that feels more natural/healthy and purpose-tied to moments (post-cooking reset, rainy-day lift, bedtime calm), not just odor masking.
content.insightText: For a segment of shoppers, air-care buying is driven by deal-chasing and rebate 'gamification' more than by scent preference, with complex stacking across store apps and Ibotta determining what gets bought and when.

content.keepBroadDescription: Get a wide-ranging view of emerging trends and opportunities across the industry.

content.suggestedFocusPills: Sustainability in Design|Multi-Functional Solutions|Space Optimization|Smart Furniture Integration|Customization Options|Consumer Trends|Eco-Friendly Materials|Urban Living Challenges|Innovative Storage Solutions|Modern Aesthetic Appeal
content.selectMarketsInstructions:
Select one or more markets to continue. For best performance, limit selection to 5 countries.
Click on a checkbox or card to select.
content.selectDataSourcesIntro1:
First party data sources are always included.
Toggle on any additional sources you want to include, then click Next to continue.
content.dataSourceFirstPartyDesc: Contains insights, market trend reports, benefits, needs, and concept test results
content.dataSourceBehavioralDesc: Pulling from Instagram, Pinterest, Reddit, TikTok, Twitter and YouTube
content.dataSourceCrossCategoryDesc: Draws data from relevant categories and makes conclusions about impact on your brand
content.dataSourceCrossCategorySocialDesc: Follows accounts in adjacent categories for consumer insights
content.dataSourceCompetitorDesc: Country-specific competitor accounts for competitive insights
content.insightStudioInstructions: Insights are based on relevant data points pulled from the sources you selected, surfaced because they align with your chosen focus. Delete any you don't want influencing the opportunity space outputs.
content.clusteringSocialLabel: Clustering hunches across social media posts:
content.clusteringSocialClue1: Clue 1: Consumers are increasingly seeking home fragrances that promote emotional wellbeing, such as stress relief, relaxation, and focus.
content.clusteringInternalClue2: Clue 2: Purchase patterns show higher repeat rates for fragrances positioned around calming or restorative benefits compared to purely decorative scent offerings.
content.opportunityScoreCopy: The score considers the opportunity against your specific brief parameters based on market factors like macro trends, community & social trends, brand capabilities, and current market demand.
content.opportunitySizingCopy: Sizing is estimated using a combination of internal and external data sources, aligned to your selected markets and focus.
content.customBriefSectionText: Leverage your existing IP / data or a custom brief to generate more opportunity spaces
content.comparisonNoReports: No validation reports to compare yet. Validate a concept to see it here.
content.sectionGlobalInsightPainpointDescription: Consumers feel frustrated by the lack of customizable furniture solutions that fit their unique needs.
content.sectionGlobalInsightJtbdDescription: Customers are looking for furniture that maximizes space while maintaining style and functionality.
content.sectionGlobalInsightTrendDescription: There is a growing trend towards furniture that serves multiple purposes, catering to smaller living spaces.
content.sectionGlobalInsightJtbdSource: Instagram Â· Home Decor Trends Â· 850 likes
content.sectionGlobalInsightTrendSource: Pinterest Â· Space Saving Ideas Â· 3.1k saves
content.sectionCrossInsight2Source: Facebook Â· Furniture Design Group Â· 1.5k reactions
content.persona1WhatChanged: Recent shifts towards sustainability have led this segment to prioritize eco-friendly furniture options.
content.persona1Description: This persona values environmentally friendly products and seeks furniture that aligns with their green lifestyle. They often research brands that prioritize sustainability.
content.persona1DescriptionBullets:
Environmentally aware
Prioritizes sustainable materials
Researches brands for eco-credentials
Seeks stylish yet responsible options
content.persona1CoreJtbd: Their core job is to furnish their home with pieces that reflect their values, ensuring minimal environmental impact while maintaining aesthetic appeal.
content.persona1BehavioralJobs:
Research sustainable brands
Choose eco-friendly materials
Share eco-tips with friends
content.persona1TriggersRoutines:
Regularly checks eco-friendly blogs
Participates in sustainability workshops
Follows eco-conscious influencers
content.persona1HiddenEmergingJobs: They are increasingly interested in upcycling furniture and exploring DIY projects to reduce waste.
content.persona2WhatChanged: As urban living spaces shrink, this persona is adapting by seeking innovative furniture solutions that save space.
content.persona2Description: This persona lives in a compact urban environment and prioritizes furniture that is functional and space-efficient. They often look for multi-purpose items that can adapt to their lifestyle.
content.persona2DescriptionBullets:
Lives in small apartments
Values functionality over size
Seeks multi-purpose furniture
Enjoys modern design aesthetics
content.persona2CoreJtbd: Their main job is to create a comfortable and stylish living space that accommodates their lifestyle without compromising on design.
content.persona2BehavioralJobs:
Browse online for space-saving ideas
Attend furniture expos for new designs
Share space optimization tips on social media
content.persona2TriggersRoutines:
Regularly declutters their space
Follows interior design trends
Engages with home organization content
content.persona2HiddenEmergingJobs: They are exploring modular furniture options that can be easily reconfigured as their needs change.
content.subject: furniture innovation

opportunities.title: Eco-Friendly Materials
opportunities.snippet: Exploring sustainable material options can enhance the brand's commitment to environmental responsibility. This is crucial for attracting eco-conscious consumers.

concepts.title: Recycled Wood Collection
concepts.overview: A line of furniture made entirely from post-consumer recycled wood, offering style and sustainability.

concepts.title: Biodegradable Upholstery
concepts.overview: Innovative upholstery options that decompose naturally, reducing landfill impact while providing comfort.

concepts.title: Bamboo Furniture Range
concepts.overview: A collection featuring bamboo, a fast-growing and renewable resource, ideal for modern furniture design.

opportunities.title: Modular and Reusable Designs
opportunities.snippet: Creating modular furniture that can be easily reconfigured promotes longevity and adaptability, appealing to modern living spaces.

concepts.title: Interchangeable Components
concepts.overview: Furniture pieces designed with interchangeable parts, allowing customers to customize their setups easily.

concepts.title: Flat-Pack Reassembly Kits
concepts.overview: Kits that enable consumers to reassemble or upgrade their flat-pack furniture for new uses or styles.

concepts.title: Multi-Functional Pieces
concepts.overview: Furniture that serves multiple purposes, reducing the need for excess items in small living spaces.
